details:
iDefense Labs reports:

> Remote exploitation of a design error in Horde's Kronolith
> could allow an authenticated web mail user to execute
> arbitrary PHP code under the security context of the running
> web server.
>
> The vulnerability specifically exists due to a design error in the
> way it includes certain files. Specifically, the 'lib/FBView.php'
> file contains a function 'Kronolith\_FreeBusy\_View::factory' which
> will include local files that are supplied via the 'view' HTTP GET
> request parameter.
summary: kronolith -- arbitrary local file inclusion vulnerability
